messages: 4398b0e63edbef4d786f2387aa2f6f55 (15:04): anyone know how to use cmake with qt4 ?

7073774da7b3e12071ac2edaf3304fb5 (15:13): sorry shastry I've never used it with cmake mate

7073774da7b3e12071ac2edaf3304fb5 (15:14): shastry: someone here will prolly answer sometime, you might have to hang about :)

4398b0e63edbef4d786f2387aa2f6f55 (15:18): now to figure out debug and install >_>
39ff917d30b2a8529d9e1d48c26f50df (15:19): Just out of interest, which approach did you take? the qt4_automoc with #include "header.moc" or the other QT4_WRAP_CPP one?
7073774da7b3e12071ac2edaf3304fb5 (15:20): shastry: what did you change to make it work
7073774da7b3e12071ac2edaf3304fb5 (15:20): please put it up on the wiki :)
4398b0e63edbef4d786f2387aa2f6f55 (15:20): mobtek: it was an error from my part
4398b0e63edbef4d786f2387aa2f6f55 (15:20): i had left out something in add_executable
4398b0e63edbef4d786f2387aa2f6f55 (15:21): i dont want to include moc in the files
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (15:21): including moc files is so 90:s
39ff917d30b2a8529d9e1d48c26f50df (15:21): I would like to know what magic the #include "header.moc" does. It seems a bit ugly to me to add that.
39ff917d30b2a8529d9e1d48c26f50df (15:22): is it replaced by the actual moc_foo.h ?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (15:27): i think it's needed sometimes if you have your class definition and implementation in the same file
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (15:28): it avoids having to separately compile the moc generated file and link it in
4398b0e63edbef4d786f2387aa2f6f55 (15:36): hrm.. cant figure out how to enable debug
9a40dbed8a883b89b8b91a9ad9e20d70 (15:53): hi, in wich code file is implemented Encodings? Unicode, ReverseUnicode, Locale...etc
39ff917d30b2a8529d9e1d48c26f50df (15:55): Another thing, does ccmake (ui-version) show some settings by default or do you have to add them manually?
39ff917d30b2a8529d9e1d48c26f50df (15:57): ah well, I should probably just try it out myself some time. So far ccmake sounds like a nice alternative to the obscure autoconf.
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (16:01): everything is better than autoconf
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (16:16): i nearly no nothing about makefiles since qmakes does the job without my knowledge
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (16:27): thats all to get a cmake make file thingy ?
39ff917d30b2a8529d9e1d48c26f50df (16:28): you can also use ccmake ../myproject. Gives you an ui where you can toggle flags.
39ff917d30b2a8529d9e1d48c26f50df (16:30): aep: there's a bit more to it. You have to write project files for cmake. So far I only compiled with cmake. Haven't done my own yet.
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (16:31): qmake is to simple to switch to anything else :(
4398b0e63edbef4d786f2387aa2f6f55 (16:31): you need to write an easy CMakeLists.txt
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (16:34): i dont see any advantages in using cmake, so i wait till somone forces me to use cmake ;)
